Functions

G_MODULE_EXPORT int gm_module_init ()
 Initializes the module. Loads the configuration and starts the applet in failed mode.
G_MODULE_EXPORT void gm_module_set_conffile (const char *filename)
 Supposed to be used by gappman to make the module aware of its configuration file Not really used so will be deprecated pretty soon.
G_MODULE_EXPORT void gm_module_start ()
 Starts the applet checking network status Uses global KEEP_RUNNING to determine if it should keep checking the network status. If KEEP_RUNNING becomes FALSE it will stop.
G_MODULE_EXPORT int gm_module_stop ()
 Stops the applet Sets KEEP_RUNNING to FALSE and frees the stati list of status structs.
G_MODULE_EXPORT void gm_module_set_icon_size (int width, int height)
 Sets the icon size as determined by gappman.
G_MODULE_EXPORT GtkWidget * gm_module_get_widget ()
 returns the button that gappman should add to the applet-bar

Detailed Description

applet showing network status and allows users to analyse and restart the network.

GPL v2

Authors: Martijn Brekhof <m.brekhof@gmail.com>

Todo:
Redesign applet making it independent from gm_netmand. Applet can call the actions itself instead of sending the command to gm_netmand
Todo:
Implement support for keybindings which should trigger the menu to pop-up.

returns the button that gappman should add to the applet-bar

Returns:
GtkWidget

G_MODULE_EXPORT int gm_module_init (  ) 

Initializes the module. Loads the configuration and starts the applet in failed mode.

Returns:
int
  • GM_SUCCES if initialization was succesful.
  • GM_COULD_NOT_LOAD_FILE if the configuration file could not be loaded.
